items.title: “The Facility” is a short documentary film chronicling the...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

“The Facility” is a short documentary film chronicling the lived experiences of immigrants being held at the GEO detention facility in Aurora, Colorado. This film addresses the personal loss and consequences caused by for-profit detention and the federal government's broken immigration policies. Legal and medical experts highlight horrific abuses including death, medical neglect, nutrition issues, and prolonged detention during the coronavirus pandemic. To tell their stories, current and former detainees, families fighting to be reunited, and advocates come together to share their experiences behind the walls of the GEO immigration detention facility in Aurora.

Sign up for the premiere screening on Dec. 18: https://aclu.zoom.us/web…/register/WN_nUbTy8-VQpif8nMzqtUzQw

items.title: More than 160 staff and 1,000 people held at El Paso County Jail...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

More than 160 staff and 1,000 people held at El Paso County Jail have contracted COVID-19. Inadequate mask distribution, nearly nonexistent quarantining efforts, mixing healthy and infected people, and other blunders have led to the worst outbreak any jail or prison in Colorado has ever seen. This year, El Paso County Sheriff received $15.6 million specifically to enact COVID-19 protections for incarcerated people and staff. Instead, this money was mismanaged and spent on unrelated renovations. On Sunday, we filed a lawsuit to protect people inside the jail, including getting more than one mask per person and enacting legitimate quarantining methods.

items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

COVID-19 is spreading like wildfire in our jails and prisons but Gov. Polis is ignoring the risks and disregarding guidance from CDPHE and the American Medical Association, which recommends vaccine priority to people living in communal settings — especially jails and prisons. The Governor's failure to safely reduce jail and prison populations in Colorado and this cruel change to the distribution plan puts all of us at risk.
